section.name: Phased Development
section.p: cPath currently uses an iterative development cycle for developing new features. At the beginning of each phase, we document a list of new features, and flesh out the functional requirements for each new feature. We also provide technical details on how to intend to implement each new feature.
The documents below contain information for each phase of cPath development so far.

tr.td: Implemented the first version of the the Data Services Module. The Data Services Module is a standalone library used by both cPath and Cytoscape to retrieve biological data from a diverse set of data sources.
Implemented the first version of the cBio web service API. The web service API was originally created to access a mirror of the GRID database, and has since been integrated into the core cPath code.
Continued expanding the Data Services Module, and created Cytoscape specific PlugIns for accessing remote data sets.
Continuted the Data Services Module, added support for network state information, and built the first prototype of the cPath web site.
Implemented the main cPath database tables for importing and linking external data sets.
Implemented the core set of cPath tables, XML import/ export functionality, and full-text search functionality.
Implemented the Cytoscape Activity Center Plugin, and expanded the cPath Web Services API. Released cPath beta 1 to the cBio web site.

Added cPath Admin functionality, created generic framework for pre-computed queries, completed load testing, created the developer site, and modified the look and feel of cPath with new stylesheets. Release beta 2 to the cBio web site
